Category.name: Surveillance Data Exchange - Part 12 ADS-B Reports

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the operational services available in the aircraft while airborne.

Bits.BitsValue: TCAS II or ACAS RA not active
no capability for Trajectory Change Reports
no capability to support Target State Reports
capable of supporting target State Reports

Bits.BitsName: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information airborne

Bits.BitsValue: TCAS not installed or not operational

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the ADS-B station providing information.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the EUROCONTROL ASTERIX Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/services/system-area-code-list).

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1- The service identification is allocated by the system. 2- The service identification is also available in item I023/015 [Ref. 3].

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of services offered by a ground station (identified by a SIC code).
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. This item contains the same information as item I023/101 in ASTERIX category 023 [Ref. 3]. Since not all service users receive category 023 data, this information has to be conveyed in category 021 as well. 2. If this item is due to be sent according to the encoding rule above, it shall be sent with the next target report

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Characteristics of the originating ADS-B unit.

Bits.BitsValue: highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knots cruise)

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Type and characteristics of the data as transmitted by a system.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable Length Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one octet, followed by one-octet extensions as necessary.

Bits.BitsValue: Range Check passed, CPR Validation pending
Equipment capable to provide Selected Altitude
Equipment not capable to provide Selected Altitude

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. Bit 3 indicates that the position reported by the target is within a credible range from the ground station. The range check is followed by the CPR validation to ensure that global and local position decoding both indicate valid position information. Bit 3=1 indicates that the range check was done, but the CPR validation is not yet completed. Once CPR validation is completed, Bit 3 will be reset to 0. 2. The second extension signals the reasons for which the report has been indicated as suspect (indication Confidence Level (CL) in the first extension). Bit 2 indicates that the Range Check failed, i.e. the target is reported outside the credible range for the Ground Station. For operational users such a target will be suppressed. In services used for monitoring the Ground Station, the target will be transmitted with bit 2 indicating the fault condition. 3. Bit 6, if set to 1, indicates that the position reported by the target was validated by an independent means and a discrepancy was ADS-B Target Reports EUROCONTROL-SPEC-0149-12 Edition : 2.4 Released Edition Page 17 detected. If no independent position check is implemented, the default value '0' is to be used. 4. Bit 5 represents the setting of the GO/NOGO-bit as defined in item I023/100 of category 023 [Ref. 3]. 5. Bit 7, if set to 1, indicates that a lookup in a Black-list/White-list failed, indicating that the target may be suspect

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.
Time of applicability of the reported position, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight. 2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the position transmitted in the target report is valid.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time of applicability (measurement) of the reported velocity, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight. 2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the velocity information transmitted in the target report is valid. 3. This item will not be available in some ADS-B technologies.

DataItem.DataItemName: Time of Message Reception for Position
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time of reception of the latest position squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.

Bits.BitsName: Time of Message Reception of Position

DataItem.DataItemNote: The time of message reception value is reset to zero at every midnight.

DataItem.DataItemName: Time of Message Reception of Position-High Precision
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time at which the latest ADS-B position information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

Bits.BitsName: Fractional part of the time of message reception for position in the ground station.

DataItem.DataItemName: Time of Message Reception for Velocity
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time of reception of the latest velocity squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.

Bits.BitsName: Time of Message Reception of Velocity

DataItem.DataItemNote: The time of message reception value is reset to zero at every midnight.

DataItem.DataItemName: Time of Message Reception of Velocity-High Precision
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time at which the latest ADS-B velocity information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

Bits.BitsName: Fractional part of the time of message reception for velocity in the ground station.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Time of the transmission of the ASTERIX category 021 report in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The time of ASTERIX report transmission value is reset to zero at every midnight.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Target address (emitter identifier) assigned uniquely to each target.
ADS-B quality indicators transmitted by a/c according to MOPS version.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable Length Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one- octet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary.

Bits.BitsName: Navigation Uncertainty Category for velocity or Navigation Accuracy Category for Velocity
Navigation Uncertainty Category for Position NUCp or Navigation Integrity Category NIC.
Navigation Integrity Category for Barometric Altitude
Horizontal Position System Design Assurance Level (as defined in version 2)

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The primary subfield is kept for backwards compatibility reasons. Version 2 NIC-values shall be mapped accordingly. This is required to ensure that downstream systems, which are not capable of interpreting extensions 2 and 3 (because they use an ASTERIX edition earlier than 2.0) still get the required information 2. 'Version 1' or 'Version 2' refers to the MOPS version as defined in data item I021/210, bits 6/4 3. PIC=0 is defined for completeness only. In this case the third extension shall not be generated. 4. For ED102A/DO260B PIC values of 7 and 9, the NIC supplements for airborne messages (NIC supplements A/B) and surface messages (NIC supplements A/C) are listed. For ED102A/DO260B PIC=8, the NIC supplements A/B for airborne messages are listed. For DO260A PIC values of 7 and 8, the NIC supplement for airborne messages is shown in brackets. The aircraft air-ground status, and hence message type (airborne or surface), is derived from the GBS-bit in I021/040, 1st extension

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Reports indicating the 4D intended trajectory of the aircraft.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one octet, followed by the indicated subfields.

Bits.BitsValue: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data. 2. TCP numbers start from zero. 3. LT = Lateral Type 4. VT = Vertical Type 5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as the absolute time from midnight. 6. TOV is meaningful only if TOA is set to 1.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates.

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS.84 in two's complement. Range -90 <= Lat <= 90 deg.
Longitude in WGS.84 in two's complement. Range -180 <= longitude < 180 deg.

DataItem.DataItemNote: Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates in high resolution.

Bits.BitsName: Latitude In WGS.84 in two's complement. Range -90 <= Lat <= 90 deg.
Longitude In WGS.84 in two's complement. Range -180 <= longitude < 180 deg.

DataItem.DataItemNote: Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Amplitude, in dBm, of ADS-B messages received by the ground station, coded in two's complement.
Minimum height from a plane tangent to the earth's ellipsoid, defined by WGS-84, in two's complement form.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO. 2. A value of '0111111111111111' indicates that the aircraft transmits a 'greater than' indication.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Flight Level from barometric measurements, not QNH corrected, in two's complement form.

The Selected Altitude as provided by the avionics and corresponding either to the MCP/FCU Selected Altitude (the ATC cleared altitude entered by the flight crew into the avionics) or to the FMS Selected Altitude.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The Selected Altitude provided in this field is not necessarily the 'Target Altitude' as defined by ICAO. 2. The value of 'Source' (bits 15/14) indicating 'unknown' or 'Aircraft Altitude' is kept for backward compatibility as these indications are not provided by 'version 2' systems as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4. 3. Vertical mode indications supporting the determination of the nature of the Selected Altitude are provided in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: The vertical intent value that corresponds with the ATC cleared altitude, as derived from the Altitude Control Panel (MCP/FCU).
DataItem.DataItemNote: This item is kept for backward compatibility but shall not be used for 'version 2' ADS-B systems (as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4) for which item 146 will be used to forward the MCP/FCU or the FMS selected altitude information. For 'version 2' ADS-B systems, the vertical mode indications will be provided through the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV .

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated Air Speed (Element of Air Vector).
True Air Speed.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the True Air Speed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE- bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Magnetic Heading (Element of Air Vector).
DataItem.DataItemNote: True North Heading is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield TNH.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Barometric Vertical Rate, in two's complement form.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Barometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Geometric Vertical Rate, in two's complement form, with reference to WGS-84.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Geometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Ground Speed and Track Angle elements of Ground Vector.

Bits.BitsName: Track Angle clockwise reference to True North

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Ground Speed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE- bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field. 2. The Surface Ground Vector format is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield SGV.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track file.
Rate of Turn, in two's complement form.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn. 2. 'Maximum value' means Maximum value or above. 3. This item will not be transmitted for the technology '1090 MHz Extended Squitter'.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters, as reported by the target.

Bits.BitsName: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 Bits each) defining target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available. Coding rules are provided in [6] Section 3.1.2.9.1.2 and Table 3-9.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Status of the target

Bits.BitsValue: Temporary Alert (change in Mode 3/A Code other than emergency)

DataItem.DataItemNote: Bit-8 (ICF), when set to '1' indicates that new information is available in the Mode S GICB registers 40, 41 or 42.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the MOPS version used by a/c to supply ADS-B information.

Bits.BitsValue: The MOPS Version is supported by the GS
The MOPS Version is not supported by the GS

DataItem.DataItemNote: Bit 7 (VNS) when set to 1 indicates that the aircraft transmits a MOPS Version indication that is not supported by the Ground Station. However, since MOPS versions are supposed to be backwards compatible, the GS has attempted to interpret the message and achieved a credible result. The fact that the MOPS version received is not supported by the GS is submitted as additional information to subsequent processing systems.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Meteorological information.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound data item consisting of a one byte primary sub-field, followed by up to four fixed length data fields.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: The roll angle, in two's complement form, of an aircraft executing a turn.

DataItemFormat.desc: A two byte fixed length data item.

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. Negative Value indicates 'Left Wing Down'. 2. Resolution provided by the technology '1090 MHz Extended Squitter' is 1 degree.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode S Comm B data as extracted from the aircraft transponder.

DataItemFormat.desc: Repetitive Data Item starting with a one-octet Field Repetition Indicator (REP) followed by at least one BDS message comprising one seven octet BDS register and one octet BDS code.

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. For the transmission of BDS20, item 170 should be used. 2. For the transmission of BDS30, item 260 is used.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the RA message and threat identity data.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. Version denotes the MOPS version as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4 2. This data items copies the value of BDS register 6,1 for message type 28, subtype 2 3. The 'TYP' and 'STYP' items are implementation (i.e. link technology) dependent. 4. Refer to ICAO Annex 10 SARPs for detailed explanations [Ref. 10].

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Operational capabilities of the aircraft while on the ground.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable Length Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one-octet, followed by an one-octet extents if necessary.

Bits.BitsValue: Position transmitted is not ADS-B position reference point
Position transmitted is the ADS-B position reference point

Bits.BitsName: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information Surface
Class B2 transmit power less than 70 Watts
Length and width of the aircraft

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. Version 2 (as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4) data technology protocols encode 'No Data or Unknown' with value 0. In this case data item I021/271, first extension is not generated. 2. As of edition 2.2 the structure of this data item has been changed. Edition 2.2 is not backwards compatible with previous editions.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Ages of the data provided.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of up to five octets, followed by the indicated subfields.

Bits.BitsName: Age of the latest received information transmitted in item I021/008.
Age of the Target Report Descriptor, item I021/040
Age of the Mode 3/A Code, item I021/070
Age of the Quality Indicators, item I021/090
Age of the Trajectory Intent information, item I021/110
Age of the message amplitude, item I021/132
Age of the Geometric Height, item 021/140
Age of the Flight Level, item I021/145
Age of the Intermediate State Selected Altitude, item I021/146
Age of the Final State Selected Altitude, item I021/148
Age of the Air Speed contained, item I021/150
Age of the value for the True Air Speed, item I021/151
Age of the value for the Magnetic Heading, item I021/152
Age of the Barometric Vertical Rate contained, I021/155
Age of the Geometric Vertical Rate, item I021/157
Age of the Ground Vector, item I021/160
Age of the Track Angle Rate, item I021/165
Age of the Target Identification, item I021/170
Age of the Target Status as contained, item I021/200
Age of the Meteorological information, I021/220
Age of the Roll Angle, item I021/230
Age of the latest update of an active ACAS Resolution Advisory, item I021/260
Age of the information on the surface capabilities and characteristics of the respective target, item I021/271

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. In all the subfields, the maximum value indicates 'maximum value or above'.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Designator of Ground Station in Distributed System.
Reserved Expansion Field of ASTERIX Cat 021 (ADS-B Reports), Edition 1.4

DataItemFormat.desc: One byte length field, followed by a one byte items indicator and the encoded items.

Bits.BitsValue: Data is either unavailable or invalid
Target is not 1090 ES IN capable
Target is not UAT IN capable

Bits.BitsName: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Bits.BitsValue: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Flight level not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Position not from Mode 5 report (ADS-B report)

Bits.BitsName: Mode 1 code from transponder or smoothed
Bits.BitsValue: Mode 1 code as derived from the report of the transponder
Smoothed Mode 1 code as provided by a local tracker

Bits.BitsName: Extended Mode 1 Code in octal representation
X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.
Bits.BitsValue: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received.
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

Bits.BitsName: Figure of Merit Position Accuracy as extracted and provided by a Mode 5 transponder
Mode 2 code from transponder or smoothed
Bits.BitsValue: Mode-2 code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-2 code as provided by a local tracker

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Special information
